quote: It’s okay to not be okay. Just don’t unpack and live there.
Don’t believe everything you think. Thoughts are not facts.
Worrying means you suffer twice.
Your speed doesn’t matter. Forward is forward.
The comeback is always stronger than the setback.
Let your joy be louder than your fear.
You don’t have to control your thoughts. You just have to stop letting them control you.
Breathe. You’re going to be okay.
Be proud of how far you’ve come, even if it doesn’t feel like enough yet.
Your feelings are valid. They don’t need permission.
Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
Excitement is the spark of possibility lighting up your future.
Anger is often just sadness in disguise. Treat both with care.
You are not a burden. You’re just having a hard time.
You are deeply loved, even when it’s hard to feel it.
Let yourself rest. You don’t need to earn your right to breathe.
Love is not about grand gestures, but quiet presence.
Fear is a natural reaction to moving closer to the truth.
It’s okay to not know what you feel. Be kind to yourself anyway.
Your guilt does not define your goodness.
There’s no shame in being human.
Pride isn’t arrogance — it’s recognizing your worth.
Love is showing up, even when it’s hard.
Peace isn’t the absence of noise, but the quiet within.
You’re not too much. You’re just enough for the right people.
Your fear means you care. That’s not weakness — it’s meaning.
Be proud of how you keep showing up even when it hurts.
Guilt is a signal. Not a sentence.
Confusion is part of clarity. It means you're asking the right questions.
Calm is a skill you can practice — not a personality trait.
Your kindness matters — even if it feels small.
Being scared and moving forward is the definition of courage.
Pride in your effort is more powerful than pride in results.
Let peace be your default, not your reward.
Even guilt can be a teacher — if you're willing to listen, not punish.
